result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500 bail applied. Total costs to be paid during period of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
No contact with victim.
Anger managment.
Submit DNA sample within 30 days.
Pay supervision fees.
Defendant ordered to have psychological evaluation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Miller

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy L Miller in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Attorney McClendon unable to appear for Plea and Sentencing Scheduled on this day due to emergency proceedings in another case.  Plea and Sentencing rescheduled to November 10th, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Miller in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now qualifies for public defender and counsel enters plea of not guilty. Further proceedings scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Miller in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def does not qualify for public defender due to assets. Court finds not indigent for court appointed counsel. Defendant waived right to an attorney. Plea of not guilty entered.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Denying Petition for Court Appointed Attorney
